subject: Data
title: Election Data: Counting Votes in the Open
description: A short lesson to help you apply Election Data: Counting Votes in the Open.

hook.text: In 2019, Bolivia's election count suddenly paused. When it resumed, the leading candidate had flipped.

buildup.text: Open election data means publishing vote tallies at the polling-station level in real time.

discovery.text: When citizens can independently verify counts, allegations of fraud can be confirmed or debunked with math.

twist.text: Some governments resist granular election data precisely because it makes manipulation detectable.

climax.text: Organizations like the Carter Center now require election data openness as a condition for certifying elections.

punchline.text: Democracy's trust depends on data transparency.

quiz.question: Why do some governments resist publishing granular election data?
